entry.def: Scorching or scorching hot weather or temperatures are very hot indeed.

example.ex: That race was run in scorching weather...
example.tran: 那次赛跑是在酷热的天气中进行的。

example.ex: It was a scorching hot day.

means.word_mean: 1. hot and dry enough to burn or parch a surface;

sentences.en: He was dizzy with the scorching sun.
sentences.cn: 他被炎热的太阳晒得晕头转向。

sentences.en: Peasants are busy weeding under the scorching sun.
sentences.cn: 农民在炎炎烈日下忙着除草。

sentences.en: I kept standing in the scorching sun for a long time,till I fainted.
sentences.cn: 我一直长时间地站在灼热的太阳下,终于昏倒了。

sentences.en: Summer pours scorching sunlight into the valleys.
sentences.cn: 夏日的骄阳照进了山谷。

sentences.en: Seville is scorching in high summer.
sentences.cn: 塞维尔的盛夏热得灼人。

sentences.en: Jack showed his dislike plainly in scorching satire.
sentences.cn: 杰克以尖刻的讽刺直率地表明了自己的厌恶。
